Remark: ` O ` , the set of ordered ordered pairs, i.e., ordered pairs in which the first component is less than the second component, can alternatively be written as ` O = { x e. ( V X. V ) | ( 1st `` x ) R ( 2nd `` x ) } ` or even as ` O = { x e. ( V X. V ) | <. ( 1st `` x ) , ( 2nd `` x ) >. e. R } ` , by which the relationship between ordered and unordered pair is immediately visible. (Contributed by AV, 18-Mar-2023.)
